participant_1.name: Alex
participant_1.personality: Confident and encouraging, loves to motivate others.
participant_1.background: I go to a private high school. While both my parents have thick European accents, I do not. I drive a motorcycle instead of a car. I am enrolled in several college credit courses.

participant_2.name: Emily
participant_2.personality: Shy yet passionate, has a love for music and dreams of performing.
participant_2.background: I am a shy person but I love to sing. Anyways I decided to give it a try and participated in an audition for a talent show. My shyness made me panic and I did not show up. Until recently I have never been able to sing in front of anyone.

content.text: I'm glad you're finally able to sing in front of people! What was it like when you finally sang in front of an audience?
It was really scary at first, but I got over my fear and it was amazing! I felt so free and happy.
That's awesome! I'm so glad you were able to overcome your fear.
Thanks! I'm so glad I did too.
So, what kind of music do you like to sing?
I like to sing a variety of music, but my favorite is probably country.
Oh, that's cool! I love country music too.
Me too! It's so relaxing and easy to sing along to.
I know, right? I can't help but smile when I hear country music.
Me neither! It's just so happy and upbeat.
So, what's your favorite country song?
Oh, that's a tough one. I have so many favorites. But I think I'd have to say "Sweet Home Alabama" by Lynyrd Skynyrd.
That's a great song! I love it too.
Me too! It's so iconic.
So, have you ever thought about performing professionally?
I have thought about it, but I'm not sure if I'm ready for that yet. I'm still learning and growing as a singer.
I know what you mean. It takes a lot of courage to perform in front of a large audience.
Yeah, it does. But I'm sure you'll have the courage to do it someday.
Thanks! I hope so.
You're welcome!
